law.catch_line: Action to contest decision of fiscal court.
law.text: From a decision of the fiscal court ordering a new road to be opened, or ordering an alteration or discontinuance of an existing road, or allowing gates to be erected across a road or abolishing existing gates, or a decision refusing any such order, the party aggrieved may bring an action in the Circuit Court of the county where the road is located to contest the decision of the fiscal court.
law.history: Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 61, sec. 6, effective July 13, 2004. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 308, effective June 17, 1978. -- Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 168, effective January 2, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4302a-1.
